title: Stand Up Loveland: No Occupation of Venezuela, No ICE Occupation
description: We stand united demanding an end to the Venezuelan occupation and the removal of reckless untrained ICE agents from our communities. Join us, stand strong and speak up. We emphasize nonviolent action and expect all participants to de-escalate potential confrontations.
raw_text:
Stand Up Loveland: No Occupation of Venezuela, No ICE Occupation ‚Ä¶

Saturday, January 10 ¬∑ 12:00 ‚Äì 2:00pm

üìç WB Eisenhower & Lincoln, Loveland, CO 80538, USA

We stand united demanding an end to the Venezuelan occupation and the removal of reckless untrained ICE agents from our communities.

Every dollar spent in wars overseas or at home is a dollar we paid for with our taxes - a dollar that could and should go to helping our communities thrive. We can have good jobs, better schools, access to healthcare and get our basic needs met. But not while our government works for billionaires and not for us.

Join us, stand strong and speak up.

Please note: A core principle behind all our events is a commitment to nonviolent action. We expect all participants to seek to de-escalate any potential confrontation with those who disagree with our values. Weapons of any kind, including those legally permitted, should not be brought to events.
raw_summary: The image announces an event called 'Stand Up Loveland: No Occupation of Venezuela, No ICE Occupation' scheduled for Saturday, January 10, from 12:00 to 2:00 PM at WB Eisenhower & Lincoln, Loveland, CO 80538, USA. This is a protest demanding an end to the Venezuelan occupation and the removal of untrained ICE agents from communities, emphasizing nonviolent action.

title: ICE OUT FOR GOOD
description: Join us for a peaceful demonstration to demand that ICE stop terrorizing U.S. cities and to hold accountable those responsible for Renee Nicole Good's murder and other innocent victims. We will line the streets dressed in black to mourn the loss of lives and freedoms.
raw_text:
ICE OUT FOR GOOD

Join us Saturday from 11am - 1 pm for a PEACEFUL demonstration to demand that ICE stop terrorizing U.S. cities and to demand accountability for the murder of Renee Nicole Good and other innocent people.

We will line the streets starting from the intersection of Harmony and Timberline in Fort Collins. Wear black to mourn the loss of lives, freedoms and democracy.
raw_summary: The image is a flyer announcing a peaceful demonstration called "ICE OUT FOR GOOD". It promotes a protest against ICE's actions in U.S. cities and calls for accountability for Renee Nicole Good's murder, among others. The event asks participants to dress in black in mourning and starts at the intersection of Harmony and Timberline in Fort Collins, from 11 am to 1 pm on a Saturday.
